item.title: Thanks ICERM! (Predictive Policing)
item.description: Last week, Marta and I had the great privilege to serve as group leaders for a team researching spatial crime networks as part of ICERM’s workshop on Predictive Policing. We are grateful to ICERM, the Providence Police Department, Jeff Brantingham, Martin Short, and our group – Haiyan, Chuntian, Matt, and Monica!

item.title: Slides and Exercises for RMarkdown
item.description: R Markdown is an authoring tool for easily sharing reproducible data analysis. If you are learning to use R Markdown, you may be interested in my recent slides and (download links) accompanying exercises.

item.title: Slides and Exercises for ggplot2
item.description: The ggplot2 package for the R programming language is the best software in the world for 2-D data visualization. If you are new to ggplot2, you may be interested in a set of simple slides I wrote, and (download links) the accompanying exercises in the R Markdown format.
